definition: to shake (a part of one's body)/to shrug (shoulders)/to create a sensation/to incite
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: She repeated the almost imperceptible shrug.
sentences.chinese: 她又輕輕聳動下肩，幾乎察覺不到動作。

sentences.english: The newspapers use these sensational stories as a weapon in the bid to gain readers.
sentences.chinese: 報紙利用聳動的故事當做武器爭取讀者。

definition: to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to stake all on one throw
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
